required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Web-Based Communication Education for Breast Cancer Survivorship Care
clinical_study.official_title: Web-Based Communication Education for Breast Cancer Survivorship Care

brief_summary.textblock: This two-phase research plan will develop and test a culturally relevant, web-based patient education program, hereafter known as E-Talkcare. The intervention aims to empower Chinese cancer patients to effectively communicate with different providers in different healthcare settings.

detailed_description.textblock: This two-phase study develops and tests the usability and efficacy of a culturally relevant, web-based patient education program, hereafter known as E-Talkcare, in improving Chinese immigrant breast cancer survivors' competence, perceived control, and self-efficacy in cancer care communication (intermediate outcomes), and patient-reported symptoms, adherence to breast cancer survivorship care guidelines, and quality of life (distal outcomes) versus the usual care control arm. In Phase I, we will use community-based participatory research (CBPR) principles to develop the intervention to educate participants about culture and communication by demonstrating how to ask for and verify information with doctors and use personalized symptom reports, and by providing question prompt lists for doctor visits. In Phase II, we will test the intervention in a pilot randomized control trial (RCT). Using Los Angeles cancer registry cases, we will enroll and randomize 118 Chinese immigrant women (diagnosed with stage 0-III breast cancer and 1-3 years post-diagnosis) to either the E-Talkcare intervention or a usual care control arm. We will conduct telephone interviews at baseline (i.e., pre-randomization), 3-, and 6-months post-randomization.

primary_outcome.description: 16 items to assess information provision, seeking, and verifying; α=.80-.89.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Patient Experiences of Cancer Care
primary_outcome.description: 10-item patient-reported communication quality with follow-up care doctors; α=.75 in Chinese
5-item measure of patient's efficacy in engaging in medical communication; α=.89 in Chinese
4-item measure of patients' perceived personal control over breast cancer; α=.71 in Chinese

secondary_outcome.description: 6 items (e.g., felt tired, exhausted, limited at work); α=.97
6 items (e.g., sleep not steady, unsatisfied, hard to fall asleep); α=.98
6 items (e.g., affecting ability to focus, interact with others, run errands); α=.95
6 items (e.g., had trouble concentrating, slow thinking, hard to concentrate); α=.95
8 items (e.g., carry heavy objects, kneeling, doing 2-hour labor work); α=.90
7 items (e.g., felt anxious, nervous, fearful, tense); α=.90
8 items (e.g., felt helpless, depressed, unhappy, hopeless); α=.90
31-item measure of patient-reported side/late effects from breast cancer treatment
26 yes-no items: receiving breast cancer follow-up care recommendations from doctors

arm_group.description: use the web-based patient education tool

intervention.description: Women in the intervention group will receive the E-Talkcare web address, a user name, and a temporary password. The participant will be able to read or listen (through audio narration) to instructions on how to complete the intervention in order, though she can freely navigate between web modules. Each module will have an ever-present indicator (showing users' progress) and a link to for users to continue navigating through modules.We will ask participants to complete the full intervention within 3 months after intervention delivery and then complete a 3-month post-randomization interview (T1). The website will remain open for six months after intervention delivery to allow participants to use QPL if they wish. A 6-month post-randomization interview (T2) will then be administered.

Survivors randomized to the usual care group will receive care from their doctors as usual, allowing us to compare the intervention against real-world practice to inform next steps. Since we do not know if the intervention will be efficacious, we decided not to provide a delayed intervention to control participants.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Eligible Chinese women must be: 1) ≥ age 18, 2) foreign-born speaking Mandarin and/or Cantonese, 3) diagnosed with breast cancer at stage 0, I, II or III, 4) 1-3 years post-diagnosis and completed primary treatment (surgery, radiation, and chemotherapy), and have 5) no recurrence, and 6) internet access.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women with other cancer types are ineligible due to different treatment complications.
